pullRequest.body:
In the presence of an adjunction `F ⊣ G` a square `F.map f ≫ g = h ≫ k` whose left map is in the image of the left adjoint commutes iff the transposed square `f ≫ (adj.homEquiv X Y') g = (adj.homEquiv X' Y) h ≫ G.map k` whose right map is in the image of the right adjoint commutes. The proof is by two instances of `homEquiv_naturality` and the `adj.homEquiv` bijection.

---

These short proofs could likely be simplified further. 

I defined two separate functions to be used to transpose squares in each direction, but perhaps this is better set up as an if and only if? If so I'd appreciate guidance on how to extract the functions in their current form for use in proofs.

Suggestions welcome.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
> I defined two separate functions to be used to transpose squares in each direction, but perhaps this is better set up as an if and only if? If so I'd appreciate guidance on how to extract the functions in their current form for use in proofs.

Additionally to these two lemmas, you may add two `_iff` lemmas.

> > I defined two separate functions to be used to transpose squares in each direction, but perhaps this is better set up as an if and only if? If so I'd appreciate guidance on how to extract the functions in their current form for use in proofs.
> 
> Additionally to these two lemmas, you may add two `_iff` lemmas.

Added. Let me know what you think.
Thanks @joelriou for both the suggestion and explanation. I've implemented it for the other proof as well.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9389352354/job/25856644616)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9389352354/job/25856643897)
Right, of course! I'm not used to using rewrites, and forget how powerful this tactic is. Thanks.

```suggestion
@[reassoc]
theorem homEquiv_naturality_left_square (f : X' ⟶ X) (g : F.obj X ⟶ Y')
```
This will automatically create another lemma `homEquiv_naturality_left_square_assoc` which can be used in proofs when the LHS/RHS are postcomposed with something.

(Same for the other lemma.)

```suggestion
    (f ≫ (adj.homEquiv X Y') g = (adj.homEquiv X' Y) h ≫ G.map k) ↔
      (F.map f ≫ g = h ≫ k) :=
  ⟨fun w ↦ by simpa only [Equiv.symm_apply_apply]
      using homEquiv_naturality_right_square adj _ _ _ _ w,
    homEquiv_naturality_left_square adj f g h k⟩
```

I suggest stating the lemma in the other direction (but unfortunately it cannot be made a `simp` lemma).

There is nothing wrong with the `where mp := ... mpr := ...` syntax, but in mathlib, we are more used to term proofs as in my suggestion when the proofs are very short, or, by using the following syntax in tactic mode otherwise:
```lean
  constructor
  · sorry -- first implication
  · sorry -- second implication
```

About, the `have transposedw := ...` syntax, when there is only one such `have`, we may use `have := ...` and use `this` instead of an explicit name. In my suggestion, I have used the tactic `simpa ... using ...`, which basically apply simp lemmas to the given term until it hopefully matches the goal.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory): transposition of commutative squares across an adjunction
